channel.title: Error ... timers?
channel.description: Well basically. If a program causes a certain error 5 times within an amount of time. I want it to stop the operation or do something along those lines. How would I do this? If you do not understand the question.. please tell me xD

item.title: Error ... timers?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

if failsafe >= 5 AND “delta time” is lower then the period you want.
then quit the thread.

For the time difference/delta time, you just store the time when the first error is acquired, and compare it to the current time.
I think you can work out the rest of it.

Read full topic

item.title: Error ... timers?
item.dc:creator: @ravekitty ravekitty
item.description:
@ravekitty wrote:

That’s exactly what I have.
Just missing the part where it only stops if 5 errors occur within a certain amount of time

Read full topic

item.title: Error ... timers?
item.dc:creator: @Skyro Arbe
item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

Declare something like

public int failSafe = 0;

Then where the error is occuring add like

failSafe++;

Then add a method like something of this sort;

public void error() {
if (failSafe == 5) {
Thread.interrupted();
System.out.println("The script has had 5 errors and has stopped to protect you");
}
}

That’s just an example.

Read full topic
